content.description: This is the obvious chimney just to the left of Atman.A perfect splitter knee and back chimney. A fun little route to tick off when you're done doing(or waiting for!) the classic's to the left and right!
content.protection: There is no gear! A solo or a TR.

content.description: The left wall has this curvy thin hands crack.  Take some thin gear for the last moves.  Like its neighbor, a sweet miniature route.

On the west side of the Yin & Yang cliff is an obvious splitter offwidth roof crack. It is a beastly climb that will have your attention from start to finish. Tape up. The crux is the first 20 feet fist stacking and foot camming through the roof.

This is the good-looking, but short, finger crack on the west face of the crag. The climbing is straightforward up until where the crack pinches off; a couple of hard moves from there will get you to the top.
content.protection: Cams from purple TCU to green camalot for the finger crack; a couple of larger pieces (#3 and #4 Camalot) for the belay at the top.
content.location: This route is located on the west face of the crag. As you're hiking to the crag, you'll see an alcove on the west face with a finger crack on its left side and an offwidth on its right side. This route tackles the finger crack. Once on top, walk off climber's right.

content.description: Climb the thin and short patina covered crack down low. The crack seams out to slab about halfway up. Finish on two bolts with delicate face moves.
content.protection: Place a small cam and a nut down low. Bring two quickdraws for the the upper half and a third quickdraw if you're going to toprope (a single anchor bolt at the top has a quicklink for lowering).
content.location: If you're at the base of yin & yang, look down and across the gully, you'll see a big block at the bottom of the wash. This climbs the back side of said block.

content.description: Follow a fun corner to the top of the formation, via hand and fist cracks, using face holds to keep the grade reasonable.  Crux comes right at the start.
content.protection: 1 each, 1-4", plus big or little gear for anchors
content.location: Obvious crack near north edge of west face, starts on the left edge of a large, obvious roof.  About 20 feet left of the offwidth "Sport Wanker Extraordinaire".  Walkoff to the south.

content.description: Climb the hand crack to the offwidth top out directly right of Big wank. Build your own anchor as someone chopped everything off this crag. This thing has so much gear itâ€™s ridiculous. The crux is definitely the offwidth finish. Great beginner practice lead and intro to placing big gear (could place a big bro or #7.) Walk off to the right.
content.protection: 1 #2, 1 #3, 1 #4, 1 #6 and that sews that thing up tight.
content.location: Right of the big wank, pretty obvious

content.description: This route can be found just right of the new bolted sport route.  Climb up the corner to the top of the feature.

Listed in Moulin's bouldering guidebook as "right slab" V1. 

  Begin about 20 feet right of Renewal (10c) on the east side of a large boulder beneath the Yin and Yang cliff. Tiptoe up a beautiful striped slab, angling rightward beneath an arching feature. Gain a small, right-facing corner and follow this to the top of the boulder. 

  Protection is small and thought-provoking. 

  Descend by either rappeling off a single bolt above Renewal, or downclimb the west/southwest side of the boulder.
content.protection: Small cams and RPs.   1ea: #000 C3 - #.75 Camalot, small RPs or offsets

content.description: Bigwank is a short but fun offwidth crack.  Very approachable for the grade.
content.location: Right of the tips corner Shortwank

content.description: The nice vertical handcrack on the right side of the crag.  A classic shorty.
This miniature (35') crag has two nice cracks.  The routes get morning sun and afternoon shade.
